blocks.block: koko 2. (Eng.) n. cocoa. There are efforts to revive the industry. The problems have been a severely fluctuating world price, black pod disease in rainy areas, and a lack of disciplined care for the trees.
koko 3. n. Fijian pudding of grated ivi fruit (Polynesian chestnut), baked in earth oven. This is a regional food of Rewa, where the tree has been common; it grows in low-lying, wet areas.
kanace - to eat together, share a meal
bose n. council, meeting. Traditional Fijian governance structure. Also: bose levu (great council), bose ni koro (village council). Syn. veibose.
matanitu n. 1. government, state, kingdom. 2. (archaic) traditional confederacy of tribes. From mata (face, front) + nitu (ghost, spirit).
tabu (Lau) adj., n. 1. forbidden, sacred, taboo. 2. restriction, prohibition. Cultural concept central to Fijian society. Var: tabu, kabu.

vatu n. stone, rock
vatu balavu long stone, standing stone
vatu ni masima coral rock
